message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SE, cs.NI 

The paper discusses the evolution of mobile malware and proposes an adversarial machine learning approach to harden malware detection systems. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Security (cs.CR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on machine learning techniques and their application to malware detection, indicating that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the construction of crafted malware samples and the need for a self-adaptive learning scheme, which suggests that it could belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with mobile applications, indicating that it could also belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category.
